summary: This is an email chain from October 30, 2019, regarding victim impact statements in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) urgently requests information from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) about the number of victims contacted and able to provide statements at a hearing, as this information is needed for a response to an appeal. The email includes a forwarded list categorizing victims by their legal representation.

events.title: Email Request for Victim Impact Statement Details
events.description: The Office of the Deputy Attorney General sends an urgent email to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York requesting details on victim participation in an impact statement hearing, due to an appeal filing.

events.title: SDNY Victim Impact Statement Hearing
events.description: A hearing was held in the Southern District of New York where victims of Jeffrey Epstein were able to make impact statements. The document references victim attendance via their attorneys.

events.title: Filing of Appeal to 11th Circuit
events.description: The petitioner in the Epstein Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) case filed an appeal to the 11th Circuit Court, contesting the district court's refusal to hold a hearing for victims.

keyFacts: The document is an internal DOJ email chain discussing logistical and legal issues surrounding victim impact statements in the Epstein case.
Attorneys Edwards, Boies, Lisa Bloom, and Allred are identified as representing multiple victims at the hearing.
The Office of the Deputy Attorney General needed urgent information on victim participation for a response to an appeal, indicating ongoing legal disputes over victims' rights.
The appeal argues that not all victims who wanted to speak could do so at the New York hearing due to insufficient notice and travel constraints.
The document lists victims anonymously as 'Jane Doe' with numbers, indicating a continued effort to protect their identities.
